text: over the past few days I've taken a
camera around Baghdad to ask Iraqis
questions posed by our readers together
with an Iraqi staff member we asked
people questions on the US troops the
Iraqi education system car bombs the
influence of Iran and the impact of the
u.s. elections some of your questions
reflected the polarized views of the war
in iraq and the opinions expressed here
are just that opinions this is not a new
survey we interviewed Sunnis and Shiites
and mixed neighborhoods but most were
middle class and male some people didn't
want their faces to appear on camera
others didn't want their full names used
I tried to select a variety of questions
and will continue to try to find answers
for your questions and future blog posts
to submit a question for a future Q&A
use the comment box below one reader
asked how do rocky people feel about the
US troops in Iraq do they think it has
helped who did they think things are
getting worse with the US troops in the
country more than ever since the
Americans came we haven't seen anything
good from them every neighborhood they
go in the Americans go overboard if they
enter an area then that area has
problems America OE if the American
government pulled out there will be
disasters in York because now we have a
school of terrorism and the terrorists
need to have someone standing in their
face America is strong and if it pulled
out then there are people are weak and
terrorism old tight control and not only
on Iraq but in all of the Arab own land
and all of the world do you agree with
your brother now I don't I think that
America is terrorism good man look at
the mental Watanuki who visit an alarm
set off the US forces did us a favor and
removing the former regime that is the
only thing that we can thank them for
but I think that they are the reason
behind most of the problems we have been
through in the last five years so do you
think that the presence of American
troops will help Iraq no it will not
help
boys a lot of Assad may said Lee be
asked is there hope among Iraqis that a
new US president will bring an end to
the war double I'll how about before the
elections and when bush was elected for
the second time we were hoping that he
gained some experience we were hoping
that he would help us more in his second
term we were very happy when he won the
elections we said that he knows Iraq and
has good relations with the presidency
and he will help us but it was the same
all the new candidates makes promises
you don't know which one is good reader
Robert Purdy asks what is the new
history curriculum like for araki
children how do they teach the past when
we are studying we are not finding out
about Saddam Hussein there has been no
change so there has been no change no
what grade are you in I am at the
seventh grade we study our civilization
and our nation was able to stand in the
face of occupation so they are teaching
us about our country Miguel rights
should the u.s. pay for the damage in
Iraq latter one no of course not we hope
that Iraq can depend on itself it is
bitter there is no problem if America
supported us but it is better if Iraq
depended on itself Kevin McKenna rights
since car bombs are terrorists mo of
choice in Baghdad and cars are also used
to carry weapons or ammunition why are
so many vehicles still allowed to be
driven around this is happening in Iraq
because of the confusion of the last
five years the borders were wide open to
the nearby countries there was also a
series of changes between the people and
the government so it was hard to stop
cars from entering rock it was hard to
stop using cars because the people have
needs people want to live and drive this
helped the bombers but we hope that the
coming phase will limit the danger the
Iraqi people have learned and with the
help of friends little
turned with the governing I'm expecting
a great developments and security and
business they will improve if we can
prevent the car bombs then Iraq will be
fine Don R asks between the u.s. and
Iran which country will have a more
beneficial effect on a rack in the
future honestly Iran and America will
not do us any good it is up to us we can
make the American leave and we can make
them stay okay but in your opinion which
one is better to Iraq I will not say but
America went to Saudi Arabia to Kuwait
and two other Arab countries look at the
development that happened it and Iran
will remain Iran I'm a Christian and not
a Muslim so I don't care about their
turbans I'm a ballet dancer and when I
came to Iraq people found that strange
and it was all so strange that I'm gay
but at the same time if I tell an
Iranian the time gay then he will get
mad and hit me and even there are keys
but if an American knew that I was gay
and by the way I live in the Green Zone
and my mother is a TV host it would be
normal to the Americans if Iran is
developed then this development is for
them and not for us but the Americans
will be different Bruce Feldman wants to
know although our relationship is
founded in a war do you think it could
lead to a positive relationship in which
we can truly become allies Dickey this
is for sure it is certain we have a
saying in Iraq shake the hand that you
cannot beat and don't stand against the
high wave and also you can see that
America is an ally for all and for our
last question Donny asks in what ways is
your life different today compared to
2002 what about compared to a year ago
only I know so I heard Geneva Thomas be
honest in the days of Saddam Hussein we
were comfortable there was fuel there
was security everything was available
now the situation is very difficult and
especially since the collapse of the
regime we are badly harmed
and I don't want to say whether Saddam
was good or not but we are talking about
reality we go back to the old days it
would be much better we have seen worse
things but hopefully 2008 will be a
better year the situation is improving
and hopefully within the coming years
this dark cloud will go away from this
nation
hey
you
